description:
The year is 2046. Haruyuki Arita is a young boy who finds himself on the lowest social rungs of his school. Ashamed of his miserable life, Haruyuki can only cope by indulging in virtual games. But that all changes when Kuroyukihime, the most popular girl in school, introduces him to a mysterious program called Brain Burst and a virtual reality called the Accel World.

(Source: VIZ Media)

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

node.description:
[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

Akira Amemiya is an animator and up-and-coming director best known for directing [SSSS.GRIDMAN](https://anilist.co/anime/99424/SSSSGRIDMAN) and being Studio Trigger founder [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/Hiroyuki-Imaishi)'s protege. Amemiya's [animation and directing](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/mini-imaishi.mp4) is very similar to Imaishi's yet is less chaotic and contains more 'retro' devices like impact frames and multi-tonal shading, drawing a lot of inspiration from [Masami Obari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/Masami-Obari). For these reasons he was frequently typecasted for old school pose-heavy mecha combat.

Amemiya is a nerdy director whose anime often heavily references other series and artists he loves, sometimes even replicating Obari's [animation sequences](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/dangaioh2.mp4) and [layouts](https://i.imgur.com/nTRdM4K.jpg), [Transformer](https://twitter.com/SSS_SGRID/status/1051063114022572033)'s color designs, and Hideaki Anno's [establishing shots](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/welcome-to-the-anno-class.jpg) as well as long-lingering framing. Amemiya called Anno's [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Evangelion/) his [favorite series before](https://i.imgur.com/nEYK186.png). Between his ode-heavy artistry he interjects personality with [subtle details](https://blog.sakugabooru.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/what-kind-of-brand-is-TOMATO-LIFE-tho.jpg), visual gags, and repurposing tonally contrasting homages into a different context.

Amemiya graduated from Tokyo University of Technology and was part of the university's anime research society. During his time there he became heavily influenced by Osaka University's anime research club [Group CAS](https://twitter.com/group_cas). At the time [Toshiyuki Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/107357/Toshiyuki-Satou) was part of the group, while [Ikehata Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/120505/Ikehata-Hiroshi) visited regularly. After a bit of indie work Amemiya joined studio Gainax and climbed up the hierarchy: from clean-up to animation direction, onto storyboarding and episode directing, until after joining studio Trigger and co-directing Kill la Kill finally having the credentials to debut with his own series.

He is married to animator [Megumi Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/120602/Megumi-Kouno).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayn_tw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mayn1021/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA1W2vPEHkRbfRTEljBPK1w)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Sachika's voice acting career began after winning the "KADOKAWA×UP-FRONT STYLE Idol Seiyuu Audition 2008" competition in February 2009. She debuted by voicing Yuri Gamagori in the anime Shangri-La.

Sachika's hobbies includes choral singing, watching comedy shows, poetry, and playing electric guitar. She is also very good friends with [Sumire Uesaka](https://anilist.co/staff/109441/Sumire-Uesaka) (whom she has called "my waifu") and [Ayaka Ohashi](https://anilist.co/staff/110903/Ayaka-Ohashi), two fellow seiyuu in the Bang Dream franchise. Sachika's favorite anime are Mobile Suit Gundam 00 and The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya, and she admires both [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) and [Yukari Tamura](https://anilist.co/staff/95027/Yukari-Tamura).

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

__Daisuke Asakura__, alternatively known as DA, is a Japanese vocalist, music producer, orchestrator, composer and arranger.

[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=naoyuki_konno)

__Naoyuki Konno__ is a Japanese animator and director. He is particularly known for his work on several adaptations of [Shoutarou Ishinomori's](https://anilist.co/staff/97478/Shoutarou-Ishinomori) works as well as his animation style, being renowned as one of the Kanada-school animators.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/神宮司訓之)

He does a wide range of design works.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__Current Residence:__ Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ WordGear

Kawahara Reki graduated from the Aoyama Gakuin University.

[Official Website](http://wordgear.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunori)

[Website](https://whv-amusic.com/altima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ALTIMA)

ALTIMA were a three-member Japanese synthpop band that formed in 2011. They announced a suspension of activities after their performance in the 2016 Animelo Summer Live. Although were reunited in 2018 for a one-off performance at the NBCUniversal ANIME×MUSIC FESTIVAL 25th Anniversary.

__Members:__
• MOTSU - [Mototaka Segawa](https://anilist.co/staff/153288) (瀬川素公) - (rap) (also in the band [m.o.v.e](https://anilist.co/staff/101875))
• SAT - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (synthesizers and composition) (also in the band [fripSide](https://anilist.co/staff/103544))
• MAON - [Maon Kurosaki](https://anilist.co/staff/106340) (黒崎真音) - (vocalist)

__Albums:__
• TRYANGLE (released March 26, 2014)

[Website](http://www.axsword.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ax_onoken) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ax.onoken)

onoken is a musician who makes his music electronically and frequently uses the electric organ to produce solidable tunes. A resident of Tokyo, Japan, Onoken speaks both Japanese and English, but apparently prefers Japanese. Recently, he took up Korean as his third language, hoping to enter the Korean market. Onoken's works are quite diverse, ranging from goa trance to Digital hardcore. Most Onoken songs have a BPM divisible by 10, but this is not always the case.

__[Website](http://www.mintjam.net/mj/)__

MintJam is a musical group. Current Members: a2c setzer TERRA  Former Members: kya A.Koga

Twitter __Satoshi Yaginuma__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger, lyricist, music producer, synthesizer keyboarder, and guitarist. He is part of the pop duo fripSide and the hip-hop/synthpop trio ALTIMA. He is also the CEO of p.m.works, Inc.
